It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of its alpine habitat. Thrixspermum neohibernicum is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
